doc.title: CSSPropertyRule: initialValue property
doc.sidebarHTML:
1. CSS Properties and Values API
  2. CSSPropertyRule
  3. Instance properties
    1. inherits
    2. initialValue
    3. name
    4. syntax
  4. Inheritance:
    1. CSSRule
  5. Related pages for CSS Properties and Values API
    1. CSS.registerProperty

value.content: The read-only initialValue nullable property of the CSSPropertyRule interface returns the initial value of the custom property registration represented by the @property rule, controlling the property's initial value.

value.title: Value
value.content: A string which is a <declaration-value> as defined in CSS Syntax 3.

value.title: Examples
value.content:
This stylesheet contains a single @property rule. The first CSSRule returned will be a CSSPropertyRule representing this rule. The initialValue property returns the string "#c0ffee" this being the value of the initial-value property in the CSS.

css

@property --property-name {
  syntax: "<color>";
  inherits: false;
  initial-value: #c0ffee;
}

js

let myRules = document.styleSheets[0].cssRules;
console.log(myRules[0].initialValue); //the string "#c0ffee"

specifications.title: CSS Properties and Values API Level 1

doc.summary: The read-only initialValue nullable property of the CSSPropertyRule interface returns the initial value of the custom property registration represented by the @property rule, controlling the property's initial value.
